_exec_summary.SummaryText:
The Valspar Corporation (Valspar) personnel in our warehouse operation in Grand Rapids, MI take great pride in maintaining a safe operation for the employees, the community, and the environment. The primary focus is to prevent accidental releases before they occur, while providing systems that minimize the  of any release that does occur and contain it in as small as area as possible.



ACCIDENTAL RELEASE PREVENTION AND EMERGENCY RESPONSE POLICIES: It is Valspar's policy to operate its facilities in a manner that protect its employees, the public, and the environment. It is our policy to adhere to all applicable federal, state and local laws. The Valspar Grand Rapids facility has a detailed, practiced Emergency Response Plan that is utilized to respond to any accidental releases.



FACILITY DESCRIPTION: The Valspar Grand Rapids warehouse stores and distributes aerosol coatings. The aerosol coatings are contained in pressurized spray cans. The spray cans utilize a flammable mixture of propane and/or isobutane as a propellant.



GENERAL ACCIDENTAL RELEASE PREVENTION PROGRAM AND CHEMICAL-SPECIFIC PREVENTION STEPS: The aerosol spray cans are stored in a designated area within the warehouse and the warehouse is equipped with a fire suppression system.



FIVE-YEAR ACCIDENT HISTORY: The Valspar Grand Rapids warehouse has never had an accident involving flammable propellants that resulted in injuries, property damage or environmental releases.



EMERGENCY RESPONSE PROGRAM: In the event of an emergency involving flammable propellants, warehouse personnel will notify the Grand Rapids Fire Department and rely on their expertise to handle the situation. We have provided the fire department with our Emergency Response Plan and members of the fire department have inspected the warehouse. In addition, Valspar has a contract with a qualified emergency response firm to aid in the cleanup of a release.



PLANNED CHANGES TO IMPROVE SAFETY: Valspar has an ongoing and continuing p
rocess to update and review our process for safety considerations.
